isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - FULLER 10 SPEED TRANSMISSIONS - REMOVE - MAINSHAFT ASSEMBLY

note.para: If transmission service will be limited to removal of the mainshaft, the input shaft does not need to be removed, but it must be moved forward to provide enough clearance to remove the mainshaft.

step1.para: Remove the six (6) bolts retaining the input bearing cover, and remove the cover ( Figure 47).
Grasp the input shaft and pull it forward until the main drive gear contacts the case wall ( Figure 48).
From the mainshaft, remove the reverse gear retaining snap ring (Figure 49).
Rotate the mainshaft reverse gear to engage the sliding clutch, and then move the gear forward over the sliding clutch to a position flush with the next gear on the mainshaft (Figure 50).
Remove the tanged washer from the mainshaft ( Figure 49).

figure.caption: Figure 50. Move Gear Into Flush Position

step1.para: Lift out and remove the upper reverse idler gear.
Grasp the mainshaft and pull rearward until the reverse gear is against the case wall.
Remove the snap rings from the rear of the countershaft (Figure 51).

note.para: To prevent part damage, Eaton recommends using a hand tool to operate the bearing removal tool in step 9 rather than an air powered tool.

step1.para: Install the bearing removal tool on the front countershaft bearing in the main case. Use the tool to push the countershaft rearward through the front bearing. Move the countershaft slowly and stop when resistance is felt (Figure 52).
If necessary, repeat steps 7 through 9 with the lower countershaft.

note.para: The lower countershaft does not need to be removed to remove the mainshaft.

step1.para: Attach the bearing puller to the upper countershaft rear bearing and remove the bearing ( Figure 53).
If the front of the countershaft is still in the front bearing, drive the countershaft forward to expose the front bearing snap ring. Then use the bearing puller to remove the bearing.
If necessary, repeat this procedure for the lower countershaft bearings.
Insert a large screwdriver between the main drive gear and the upper countershaft driven gear to hold the countershaft to the side and away from the mainshaft ( Figure 54).
Make sure the mainshaft reverse gear is moved forward and held against the next gear (1st speed gear).
Position the mainshaft hook tool or rope around the mainshaft (Figure 54).

note.para: Keep the upper countershaft forward against the case front wall.

step1.para: Pull the mainshaft to the rear to free the pilot from the input shaft pocket.

warning.para: Be careful when removing the mainshaft assembly. The sliding clutch on the front and the reverse gear on the back can slip off the shaft.

step1.para: Tilt the mainshaft front up and lift the assembly from the case.
